definition: Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
(of markets, industries, infectious diseases etc) rising/emerging/in the ascendant
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong
Xinxing district of Qitaihe city 七台河[Qi1 tai2 he2], Heilongjiang/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan

pinyin: xin1 xing1 jing1 ji4 guo2 jia1

sentences.english: At the same time, banks in Western Europe are neck-deep in shaky loans to these countries.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，西欧银行的贷款也深陷新兴市场国家。

sentences.english: The new nation needs a modern-minded ruler.
sentences.chinese: 这个新兴的国家需要有现代头脑之统治者。

sentences.english: The emerging world has a big stake in the European crisis.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲危机和新兴国家利害攸关。

sentences.english: China is not the only emerging financier playing a major role in Africa.?
sentences.chinese: 中国不仅是在非洲发挥重要作用的惟一的新兴融资方。

sentences.english: The technology of magnetic fluid viscosity drag reduction is a new one.
sentences.chinese: 磁性液体粘性减阻技术是一种新兴的技术。

sentences.english: These ties among our people are the life blood of our emerging partnership.
sentences.chinese: 我们人民之间的纽带是我们新兴伙伴关系的生命力。

sentences.english: Project management is an emerging professional discipline that has received considerable attention even in the boardroom.
sentences.chinese: 专案管理是目前引起相当多注意的新兴专业训練。

sentences.english: The ater-style wedding is now a new style of wedding ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 剧院式婚礼是当下一种新兴的时尚婚礼仪式。

sentences.english: The United States, according to Hormats, should listen to and carefully consider input from emerging economies.
sentences.chinese: 霍马茨说，美国应倾听并认真考虑新兴经济体的意见。

sentences.english: Oh, so they are just a new group of the model world.
sentences.chinese: 噢，那她们只是模特界的一个新兴群体。

sentences.english: A exert earthing to emerging-market economies weselves too be at hor.
sentences.chinese: 新兴留洋探索经济体制的硬着陆也即将到来。

sentences.english: Parents-children education is a newly sprung up education mode in the China.
sentences.chinese: 亲子教育是我国新兴的一种早的教育模式。

sentences.english: Modern News Narratology is the theoretical foundation of this paper.
sentences.chinese: 新兴的新闻叙事学是本文的理论基础。

sentences.english: UDT was designed to effectively utilize the rapidly emerging high-speed wide area optical networks.
sentences.chinese: UDT设计有效地利用快速新兴的高速广域光网络。

sentences.english: Firstly, an M/G/1 retrial queue with two-phase service, feedback and preemptive resume discipline is considered.
sentences.chinese: 重试排队系统是排队论中一个新兴的重要的研究内容。

sentences.english: Metallogeny is an applied branch of the earth sciences.
sentences.chinese: 成矿学是地球科学中一门很有应用价值的新兴学科。

definition: to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
